intro: Woodiellantha sympetala, commonly known as the Cape Flats lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it produces tall, branched stems that bear clusters of pale yellow to orange flowers. Woodiellantha sympetala is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
